intro: Cascarilla stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit cascarilla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with humid climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, reddish-brown fruit that contains a single seed. It is often found in lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in shaded environments. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
